quote: A pleasant illusion is better than a harsh reality.
A theory must be tempered with reality.
A pleasant illusion is better than a harsh reality.
A theory must be tempered with reality.
Art is not a study of positive reality, it is the seeking for ideal truth.
Attachment is the great fabricator of illusions; reality can be attained only by someone who is detached.
Better a dish of illusion and a hearty appetite for life, than a feast of reality and indigestion therewith.
Censors tend to do what only psychotics do: they confuse reality with illusion.
Chaos is the score upon which reality is written.
Either you deal with what is the reality, or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality, because reality is a spirit.
Fantasy is often closer to reality than what most people accept as reality.
Fiction is based on reality unless you're a fairytale artist.
Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
He who thinks he is raising a mound may only in reality be digging a pit.
How hard it is, sometimes, to trust the evidence of one's senses! How reluctantly the mind consents to reality.
Humankind cannot bear very much reality.
I accept reality and dare not question it.
I have spent my life judging the distance between American reality and the American dream.
I paint and sculpt to get a grip on reality... to protect myself.
I prefer the honest jargon of reality to the outright lies of books.
I reject your reality and substitute my own.
Idealism is fine, but as it approaches reality the cost becomes prohibitive.
Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality.
In business, words are words; explanations are explanations, promises are promises, but only performance is reality.
In reality there is no cause or effect, there is only the indifference of the universe.
Intuition comes very close to clairvoyance; it appears to be the extrasensory perception of reality.
It is far harder to kill a phantom than a reality.
Leadership is the wise use of power. Power is the capacity to translate intention into reality and sustain it.
Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.
Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
Like everything metaphysical the harmony between thought and reality is to be found in the grammar of the language.
Loneliness, insomnia, and change: the fear of these is even worse than the reality.
Many a man thinks he is patient when, in reality, he is indifferent.
Meaning and reality were not hidden somewhere behind things, they were in them, in all of them.
Measure not by the scale of perfection the meager product of reality.
Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes, but few have the gift of penetration.
Most of the images of reality on which we base our actions are really based on vicarious experience.
No authority is higher than reality.
Only reality interests me now and I know I could spend the rest of my life in copying a chair.
Only the other world has substance and reality; only good deeds and holy learning have tangible worth.
Other people's opinion of you does not have to become your reality.
Our intention creates our reality.
Our intention creates our reality.
People say they love truth, but in reality they want to believe that which they love is true.
Pleasure may come from illusion, but happiness can come only of reality.
Reality can destroy the dream, why shouldn't the dream destroy reality?
Reality can destroy the dream, why shouldn't the dream destroy reality?
Reality can destroy the dream; why shouldn't the dream destroy reality?
Reality exists in the human mind, and nowhere else.
Reality in our century is not something to be faced.
Reality is a formless lure,
Reality is for people who can't face drugs.
Reality is frequently inaccurate.
Reality is merely an illusion , albeit a very persistent one.
Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
Reality is neither good nor bad; it just is.
Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
Reality is something you rise above.
Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
Reality is the crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
Reality is whatever refuses to go away when I stop believing in it.
Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.
Reality isn't the way you wish things to be, nor the way they appear to be, but the way they actually are.
Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
Reality, if rightly interpreted, is grander than fiction.
Repetition is the reality and the seriousness of life.
Socialism is like a dream. Sooner or later you wake up to reality.
Someone's opinion of you does not have to become your reality.
Sometimes legends make reality, and become more useful than the facts.
Strange how paranoia can link up with reality now and then.
Taste is more to do with manners than appearances. Taste is both myth and reality; it is not a style.
Television is actually closer to reality than anything in books. The madness of TV is the madness of human life.
The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.
The brotherhood of man is not a mere poet's dream: it is a most depressing and humiliating reality.
The highest problem of any art is to cause by appearance the illusion of a higher reality.
The imagination equips us to perceive reality when it is not fully materialized.
The present is the only reality and the only certainty.
The supreme reality of our time is the vulnerability of this planet.
The Third World is not a reality but an ideology.
The trouble with fiction, said John Rivers, is that it makes too much sense. Reality never makes sense.
The ultimate security is your understanding of reality.
There are many ways to be free. One of them is to transcend reality by imagination, as I try to do.
There are more things to alarm us than to harm us, and we suffer more often in apprehension than reality.
There is no unique picture of reality.
Truth in philosophy means that concept and external reality correspond.
Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
Truth is reality.
Uncertainty is the worst of all evils until the moment when reality makes us regret uncertainty.
Virtue cannot separate itself from reality without becoming a principle of evil.
Visualization and belief in a pattern of reality, Activates the creative power of Realization.
Vulgarity is, in reality, nothing but a modern, chic, pert descendant of the goddess Dullness.
We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
We are shaped by each other. We adjust not to the reality of a world, but to the reality of other thinkers.
We cannot pretend that reality is different from what it is.
We think that we suffer from ingratitude, while in reality we suffer from self-love.
Whatever we plant in our subconscious mind and nourish with repetition and emotion will one day become a reality.
Whatever you believe with feeling becomes your reality.
When a team outgrows individual performance and learns team confidence, excellency becomes a reality.
Why is it that reality, when set down untransposed in a book, sounds false?
Wine makes a poor man rich in imagination, a rich man poor in reality.
Women's propensity to share confidences is universal. We confirm our reality by sharing.
Words have no power to impress the mind without the exquisite horror of their reality.
Words, as is well known, are the great foes of reality.
You take on the responsibility for making your dream a reality.
You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who says it.
Your thoughts do not create reality, but they do create your experience.
